KSFoundation  [Feb-2019]
A platform for simpler EPIC programming on GE MR systems

Detailed Description

This file contains functions only accessible on HOST.

◆ ks_init_slewratecontrol()

STATUS ks_init_slewratecontrol ( LOG_GRAD *  loggrd,
PHYS_GRAD *  phygrd,
float  srfact 
)

Changes existing (globally used) loggrd and phygrd structs (set up by inittargets() in e.g. GEReq_init_gradspecs())

If srfact < 1.0, both phygrd and loggrd are updated, and the gradients will be switched propotionally slower. This can be used to make the acquistion quieter. If srfact > 1.0, only loggrd will be updated. This could be used as an attempt to switch the gradients faster, but should be used with care as the risk for peripheral nerve stimulation (PNS) increases and the gradients may trip.

Parameters
[in,out]loggrdPointer to LOG_GRAD
[in,out]phygrdPointer to PHYS_GRAD
[in]srfactSlewrate factor (< 1.0 means less acquistic noise and reduced risk for PNS)
Returns
void
104  {
105 
106  if (fabs(srfact) < FLT_EPSILON) {
107  return ks_error("%s: slewrate factor can not be zero", __FUNCTION__);
108  }
109 
110  if (srfact < 1.0 && phygrd != NULL) {
111  phygrd->xrt = (int) ((float) phygrd->xrt / srfact);
112  phygrd->yrt = (int) ((float) phygrd->yrt / srfact);
113  phygrd->zrt = (int) ((float) phygrd->zrt / srfact);
114  }
115 
116  if (loggrd != NULL) {
117  loggrd->xrt = (int) ((float) loggrd->xrt / srfact);
118  loggrd->yrt = (int) ((float) loggrd->yrt / srfact);
119  loggrd->zrt = (int) ((float) loggrd->zrt / srfact);
120  }
121 
122  return SUCCESS;
123 }
ks_error
STATUS ks_error(const char *format,...) __attribute__((format(printf
Common error message function for HOST and TGT
phygrd
PHYS_GRAD phygrd
loggrd
LOG_GRAD loggrd

◆ ks_eval_addtoseqcollection()

STATUS ks_eval_addtoseqcollection ( KS_SEQ_COLLECTION *  seqcollection,
KS_SEQ_CONTROL *  seqctrl 
)

Adds a sequence module (KS_SEQ_CONTROL) to the KS_SEQ_COLLECTION struct for later RF scaling and SAR calculations

The KS_SEQ_CONTROL object will be ignored if added previously or if its .duration field is zero. A zero duration of a KS_SEQ_CONTROL indicates that this sequence module should not be used with the current settings

Parameters
[in,out]seqcollectionPointer to the KS_SEQ_COLLECTION for the sequence
[in]seqctrlPointer to KS_SEQ_CONTROL
Return values
STATUSSUCCESS or FAILURE
130  {
131  int i;
132 
133  if (seqcollection == NULL) {
134  return ks_error("%s: seqcollection is NULL", __FUNCTION__);
135  }
136 
137  if (seqctrl->duration == 0) {
138  /* Return early if seqctrl.duration = 0 so we are not adding sequence modules with zero duration to the collection.
139  This is in concert with:
140  - not performing createseq() in KS_SEQLENGTH if seqctrl.duration = 0
141  - not playing sequence modules in scan() using ks_scan_playsequence() if seqctrl.duration = 0
142 
143  It is the task of the PG function (e.g. <seqmodule>_pg()) of the current sequence module to set seqctrl.duration > 0 based on the waveform content in that module
144  and <seqmodule>_pg() should therefore be called before this function.
145  Preferred method is to add the following to the end of <seqmodule>_pg():
146  #ifndef IPG
147  // HOST only:
148  ks_eval_seqctrl_setminduration(&seqctrl, tmploc.pos); // tmploc.pos now corresponds to the end of last gradient in the sequence
149  #endif
150  */
151  return SUCCESS;
152  }
153 
154  if (seqcollection->numseq > KS_MAXUNIQUE_SEQUENCES) {
155  return ks_error("%s: Number of sequence modules has been exceeded (max: %d)", __FUNCTION__, KS_MAXUNIQUE_SEQUENCES);
156  }
157 
158  if (seqcollection->mode == KS_SEQ_COLLECTION_LOCKED) {
159  return ks_error("%s - (%s): seqcollection.mode = KS_SEQ_COLLECTION_LOCKED. Module must be added before GEReq_eval_TR(), GEReq_eval_rfscaling(), and GEReq_eval_checkTR_SAR()", __FUNCTION__, seqctrl->description);
160  }
161 
162  /* check for previous registrations of this sequence module. If found, return */
163  if (seqcollection->numseq > 0) {
164  for (i = 0; i < seqcollection->numseq; i++) {
165  if (seqcollection->seqctrlptr[i] == seqctrl)
166  return SUCCESS;
167  }
168  }
169 
170  /* register the sequence module */
171  seqcollection->seqctrlptr[seqcollection->numseq++] = seqctrl;
172 
173  return SUCCESS;
174 }
ks_error

◆ ks_eval_wait()

STATUS ks_eval_wait ( KS_WAIT *  wait,
const char *const  desc,
int  maxduration 
)

Sets up a wait pulse using a KS_WAIT sequence object

This function should be called in cveval() and defines a wait pulse whose duration can be changed at scan-time up to .duration [us].

If ks_eval_wait() returns FAILURE, one must also make sure cveval() returns FAILURE, otherwise an error message created in ks_eval_wait() will not be seen in the UI.

Parameters
[out]waitPointer to the KS_WAIT object to be set up
[in]descA description (text string) of the KS_WAIT object. This description is used for pulse sequence generation (seen in the file generated by TimeHist in MGD Sim/WTools)
[in]maxdurationThe desired maximum duration in [us] of the KS_WAIT object
Return values
STATUSSUCCESS or FAILURE
179  {
180 
181  ks_init_wait(wait);
182 
183  if (desc == NULL || desc[0] == ' ') {
184  return ks_error("ks_eval_wait desc (2nd arg) cannot be NULL or begin with a space");
185  } else {
186  strncpy(wait->description, desc, KS_DESCRIPTION_LENGTH - 1);
187  }
188 
189 
190  wait->duration = duration;
191 
192  /* initialize counters to 0 */
193  wait->base.ninst = 0;
194  wait->base.ngenerated = 0;
195  wait->base.next = NULL;
196 
197  return SUCCESS;
198 }

See also ks_pg_isirot() and ks_scan_isirotate().

Return values
STATUSSUCCESS or FAILURE
202  {
203  STATUS status;
204  char tmpdesc[KS_DESCRIPTION_LENGTH];
205 
206  if ((isinumber < 4) || (isinumber > 7)) {
207  return ks_error("%s: ISI number out of range (should be 4-7)", __FUNCTION__);
208  }
209 
210  sprintf(tmpdesc, "%s_isirotfun", desc);
211  status = ks_eval_wait(&isirot->waitfun, tmpdesc, RUP_GRD(KS_ISI_time));
212  if (status != SUCCESS) return status;
213 
214  sprintf(tmpdesc, "%s_isirotupdate", desc);
215  status = ks_eval_wait(&isirot->waitrot, tmpdesc, RUP_GRD(KS_ISI_rotupdatetime));
216  if (status != SUCCESS) return status;
217

219  isirot->duration = isirot->waitfun.duration + isirot->waitrot.duration;
220  isirot->counter = 0;
221  isirot->numinstances = 0;
222 
223  return SUCCESS;

◆ ks_eval_read()

STATUS ks_eval_read ( KS_READ *  read,
const char *const  desc 
)

Sets up a data acquisition window using a KS_READ sequence object

This function should be called in cveval() and defines a data acquisition window of a certain duration with some receiver bandwidth. Before calling this function, the following fields in the KS_READ object must be set:

  • .rbw: The desired receiver bandwidth / FOV in [kHz] (max: 250)
  • .duration: The duration in [us]

ks_eval_read() will validate the desired rBW and round it to the nearest valid value. Also the duration will be rounded up to fit a whole number of samples in the acquisition window.

To use an acquisition window with a gradient, see KS_READTRAP and ks_eval_readtrap()

If ks_eval_read() returns FAILURE, one must also make sure cveval() returns FAILURE, otherwise an error message created in ks_eval_read() will not be seen in the UI.

Parameters
[in,out]readPointer to the KS_READ object to be set up
[in]descA description (text string) of the KS_READ object. This description is used for pulse sequence generation (seen in the file generated by TimeHist in MGD Sim/WTools)
Return values
STATUSSUCCESS or FAILURE
230  {
231  char tmpdesc[KS_DESCRIPTION_LENGTH];
232  int duration;
233  float rbw;
234  int tsp;
235  int noutputs;
236 
237  /* store desired inputs before resetting */
238  duration = read->duration;
239  rbw = read->rbw;
240  strcpy(tmpdesc, desc); /* copy in case the read->description has been passed in before ks_init_read wipes it */
241 
242  /* Reset all fields (after saving the desired info) */
243  ks_init_read(read);
244 
245  /* put back the input fields */
246  read->duration = duration;
247  read->rbw = ks_calc_nearestbw(rbw); /* round to nearest valid rBW */
248  tsp = ks_calc_bw2tsp(read->rbw);
249  strncpy(read->description, tmpdesc, KS_DESCRIPTION_LENGTH - 1);
250  read->description[KS_DESCRIPTION_LENGTH - 1] = 0;
251 
252  /* don't allow empty description or a description with leading space */
253  if (read->description == NULL || read->description[0] == ' ') {
254  return ks_error("ks_eval_read: read name (2nd arg) cannot be NULL or leading space");
255  }
256 
257  if (read->rbw <= 0) {
258  return ks_error("ks_eval_read: field 'rbw' (1st arg) is not set");
259  }
260  if (read->duration <= 2) {
261  return ks_error("ks_eval_read: field 'duration' (1st arg) must be a positive number in [us]");
262  }
263 
264  noutputs = CEIL_DIV(read->duration, tsp);
265  read->duration = noutputs * tsp;
266 
267  /* calculate read->filter (FILTER_INFO) */
268  if (ks_calc_filter(&read->filt, tsp, read->duration) == FAILURE)
269  return FAILURE;
270 
271  return SUCCESS;
272 }
ks_calc_nearestbw
float ks_calc_nearestbw(float bw)
Round receiver bandwidth to nearest valid value
Definition: KSFoundation_host.c:3385
ks_init_read
void ks_init_read(KS_READ *read)
Resets a KS_READ sequence object to its default value (KS_INIT_READ)
Definition: KSFoundation_host.c:41
ks_calc_filter
STATUS ks_calc_filter(FILTER_INFO *echortf, int tsp, int duration)
Sets up GE&#39;s FILTER_INFO struct based on dwell (sample point) time and duration of an acquisition win...
Definition: KSFoundation_host.c:3346
ks_error
STATUS ks_error(const char *format,...) __attribute__((format(printf
Common error message function for HOST and TGT
KS_READ::rbw
float rbw
Definition: KSFoundation.h:584
KS_READ::description

Definition: KSFoundation.h:582

◆ ks_eval_trap_constrained()

STATUS ks_eval_trap_constrained ( KS_TRAP *  trap,
const char *const  desc,
float  ampmax,
float  slewrate,
int  minduration 
)

Sets up a trapezoid using a KS_TRAP sequence object with gradient constraints specified as input arguments

Before calling this function, the following field in the KS_TRAP object must be set:

  • .area: Desired gradient area in units of [(G/cm) * us]

ks_eval_trap_constrained() will make a trapezoid pulse with the desired area, constrained by the specified maximum gradient amplitude, slewrate, and minimum plateau time (args 3-5).

If ks_eval_trap_constrained() returns FAILURE, one must also make sure cveval() returns FAILURE, otherwise an error message created in ks_eval_trap_constrained() will not be seen in the UI.

There are three wrapper functions to this function (ks_eval_trap(), ks_eval_trap1(), ks_eval_trap2()) that have reduced number of input arguments, and calls ks_eval_trap_constrained() with different preset gradient constraints. ks_eval_trap() makes fewest assumptions, making it the most general choice.

Parameters
[in,out]trapPointer to the KS_TRAP object to be set up
[in]descA description (text string) of the KS_TRAP object. This description is used for pulse sequence generation (seen in the file generated by TimeHist in MGD Sim/WTools)
[in]ampmaxThe maximum allowed gradient amplitude ([G/cm])
[in]slewrateThe maximum allowed slewrate ([(G/cm) / us]). Value of 0.01 corresponds to 100 mT/m/s
[in]mindurationOptional minimum duration ([us]). A zero value is used to disregard this constraint
Return values
STATUSSUCCESS or FAILURE
276  {
277  double triangletrapezoid_area;
278  double maxramp_area;
279  double requested_area;
280  int maxramp_duration;
281  int sign_reqarea;
282  int minplateautime = KS_MINPLATEAUTIME;
283  char tmpdesc[KS_DESCRIPTION_LENGTH];
284 
285  /* store desired inputs before resetting the trap object */
286  requested_area = (double) trap->area;
287  strcpy(tmpdesc, desc); /* copy in case the trap->description has been passed in before ks_init_trap wipes it */
288 
289  /* Reset all fields and waveforms (after saving the desired area) */
290  ks_init_trap(trap);
291 
292  /* put back the input fields */
293  trap->area = requested_area;
294 
295  strncpy(trap->description, tmpdesc, KS_DESCRIPTION_LENGTH - 1);
296  trap->description[KS_DESCRIPTION_LENGTH - 1] = 0;
297 
298  /* don't allow empty description or a description with leading space */
299  if (trap->description == NULL || trap->description[0] == ' ') {
300  return ks_error("ks_eval_trap: trap name (2nd arg) cannot be NULL or leading space");
301  }
302 
303  if (requested_area == 0) {
304  return SUCCESS;
305  }
306 
307  /* sign control: Store the sign of the requested area. Ignore all other signs */
308  sign_reqarea = (requested_area < 0) ? -1 : 1;
309  requested_area = fabs(requested_area);
310  slewrate = fabs(slewrate);
311  ampmax = fabs(ampmax);
312 
313  /* make sure the minimum duration is divisible by 8us */
314  minduration = RUP_FACTOR(minduration, 2 * GRAD_UPDATE_TIME);
315 
316 
317  /* area for one ramp from zero to max amplitude ('ampmax') */
318  maxramp_duration = RUP_GRD(ceil((double) ampmax / (double) slewrate)); /* [usec] */
319  maxramp_area = (double) ampmax * ((double) maxramp_duration) / 2.0; /* [G/cm * usec] */
320 
321  /* area for a trapezoid with a plateau time of 'minplateautime' and maximum amplitude ('ampmax') */
322  triangletrapezoid_area = ((double) minplateautime * (double) ampmax) + (2.0 * maxramp_area);
323 
324  if (requested_area > triangletrapezoid_area) {
325  /* ________......ampmax
326  / \
327  / \
328  / \
329  __/ \__
330 
331  We need max target amplitude and use a plateau time > minplateautime to reach required area. [amp = ampmax] */
332 
333  trap->ramptime = maxramp_duration;
334  trap->plateautime = (int) ceil((requested_area - 2.0 * maxramp_area) / (double) ampmax);
335 
336  /* Round *up* to nearest 8us to make the plateau contain an even # of points (which is always nice) */
337  trap->plateautime = RUP_FACTOR(trap->plateautime, 2 * GRAD_UPDATE_TIME);
338 
339 
340  } else {
341  /*
342  ......... ampmax
343 
344  _ amp
345  / \
346  / \
347  __/ \__
348 
349  We don't need max amplitude and will use a minimum plateau time of minplateautime
350  [amp = ramptime * slewrate] */
351 
352  trap->plateautime = minplateautime; /* Our minimum plateau time */
353 
354  /* Quadratic solution in 'ramptime':
355  slewrate*(ramptime)^2 + slewrate*minplateautime*(ramptime) - requested_area = 0
356  ...where: ramptime = unknownamp / slewrate <=> unknownamp = ramptime * slewrate */
357  trap->ramptime = ((int) ceil(pow(requested_area / (double) slewrate + ((double) minplateautime * (double) minplateautime) / 4.0, 0.5))) - minplateautime / 2;
358 
359  /* Round *up* to nearest GRAD_UPDATE_TIME (unit: usec) */
360  trap->ramptime = RUP_GRD(trap->ramptime);
361  }
362 
363 
364  /* amp (G/cm). Make the sign of the amp equal to that of the requested_area */
365  trap->amp = (float) (sign_reqarea * requested_area / ((double) (trap->ramptime + trap->plateautime)));
366 
367  /* amp watchdog */
368  if (fabs(trap->amp) > ampmax)
369  return ks_error("ks_eval_trap: amp (%.3f) of trap '%s' exceeds ampmax (%.3f)", trap->amp, trap->description, ampmax);
370 
371  /* store the duration */
372  trap->duration = trap->ramptime * 2 + trap->plateautime;
373 
374  /* if the duration is smaller than the minimum duration, increase the ramp times and reduce the gradient amp accordingly */
375  if (trap->duration < minduration) {
376  trap->ramptime += (minduration - trap->duration)/2;
377  trap->duration = trap->ramptime * 2 + trap->plateautime;
378  trap->amp = (float) (sign_reqarea * requested_area / ((double) (trap->ramptime + trap->plateautime)));
379  }
380 
381 
382  return SUCCESS;
383 
384 }
KS_TRAP::plateautime
int plateautime
Definition: KSFoundation.h:436
ks_error
STATUS ks_error(const char *format,...) __attribute__((format(printf
Common error message function for HOST and TGT
ks_init_trap
void ks_init_trap(KS_TRAP *trap)
Resets a KS_TRAP sequence object to its default value (KS_INIT_TRAP)
Definition: KSFoundation_host.c:45
KS_DESCRIPTION_LENGTH
#define KS_DESCRIPTION_LENGTH
Definition: KSFoundation.h:112
KS_TRAP::area
float area
Definition: KSFoundation.h:434
KS_TRAP::amp
float amp
Definition: KSFoundation.h:433
KS_TRAP::description
KS_DESCRIPTION description
Definition: KSFoundation.h:432
KS_MINPLATEAUTIME
#define KS_MINPLATEAUTIME
Definition: KSFoundation.h:81
KS_TRAP::duration
int duration
Definition: KSFoundation.h:437
KS_TRAP::ramptime
int ramptime
Definition: KSFoundation.h:435

◆ ks_eval_trap()

STATUS ks_eval_trap ( KS_TRAP *  trap,
const char *const  desc 
)

Sets up a trapezoid using a KS_TRAP sequence object with preset gradient constraints

Before calling this function, the following field in the KS_TRAP object must be set:

  • .area: Desired gradient area in units of [(G/cm) * us]

This is a wrapper function to ks_eval_trap_constrained() with gradient constraints set to allow this KS_TRAP to be simultaneously played on XGRAD, YGRAD, ZGRAD for any slice angulation.

[in,out]trapPointer to the KS_TRAP object to be set up
[in]descA description (text string) of the KS_TRAP object. This description is used for pulse sequence generation (seen in the file generated by TimeHist in MGD Sim/WTools)
Return values
STATUSSUCCESS or FAILURE
391  {
392 
393  return ks_eval_trap_constrained(trap, desc, ks_syslimits_ampmax(loggrd), ks_syslimits_slewrate(loggrd), 0);
394 
395 }

Sets up a trapezoid using a KS_TRAP sequence object with gradient constraints specified as input argu...

Before calling this function, the following field in the KS_TRAP object must be set:

Sets up a trapezoid using a KS_TRAP sequence object with preset gradient constraints

Before calling this function, the following field in the KS_TRAP object must be set:

◆ ks_eval_readtrap_constrained()

STATUS ks_eval_readtrap_constrained ( KS_READTRAP *  readtrap,
const char *const  desc,
float  ampmax,
float  slewrate 
)

Sets up an acquisition window with a trapezoid, subject to gradient constraints specified as input arguments

Before calling this function, the following fields in the KS_READTRAP object must be set:

  1. .fov: Desired image Field-of-View (FOV) in [mm] along the sequence board one intends to place the KS_READTRAP on (typically XGRAD)
  2. .res: Number of pixels within the FOV
  3. .acq.rbw: Receiver bandwidth (rBW) in [kHz/FOV]. Maximum is 250
  4. .rampsampling: If non-zero, data acquisition will be performed on the ramps of the trapezoid as well. This reduces the readout time, especially for high rBWs.
  5. .acqdelay: Needs to be set only if .rampsampling = 1. The .acqdelay (in [us]) will dictate the time from the start of the ramp-up until data acquisition will begin
  6. .nover: Number of 'overscans'. If 0, a full echo will be generated (filling k-space). If > 0, fractional echo (i.e. shorter TE) will be set up with .nover number of extra sample points beyond .res/2. The total number of samples will be .res/2 + .nover. Values of .nover between 1 and about 16 should be avoided since half Fourier reconstruction methods will likely have difficulties.

If the KS_READTRAP object is initialized with KS_INIT_READTRAP, the fields .nover, .rampsampling and .acqdelay will all be zero (steps 4-6 can be skipped)

Based on the information in the KS_READTRAP object, ks_eval_readtrap_constrained() will set up its .grad trapezoid (KS_TRAP) and its acquisition window .acq (KS_READ), constrained by the specified maximum gradient amplitude, slewrate, and minimum plateau time (args 3-5).

If .rampsampling = 1, ks_eval_readtrap_constrained() will also copy the shape of .grad to .omega (also a KS_TRAP). This is needed for FOV-offsets in the readout direction when data acquisition is done on both the ramps and on the plateau, and ks_pg_readtrap() and ks_scan_offsetfov() will handle the .omega KS_TRAP so that the intended FOV shift in [mm] will be performed.

ks_eval_readtrap_constrained() will also fill in the convenience fields .area2center and .time2center properly. .area2center is useful to use as .area for a read dephaser, and .time2center makes sequence timing calculations easier. Both fields take partial/full Fourier (.nover) into account.

If ks_eval_readtrap_constrained() returns FAILURE, one must also make sure cveval() returns FAILURE, otherwise an error message created in ks_eval_readtrap_constrained() will not be seen in the UI.

There are three wrapper functions to this function (ks_eval_readtrap(), ks_eval_readtrap1(), ks_eval_readtrap2()) that have reduced number of input arguments, and calls ks_eval_readtrap_constrained() with different preset gradient constraints. ks_eval_readtrap() makes fewest assumptions, making it the most general choice.

Parameters
[in,out]readtrapPointer to the KS_READTRAP object to be set up
[in]descA description (text string) of the KS_READTRAP object. This description is used for pulse sequence generation (seen in the file generated by TimeHist in MGD Sim/WTools)
[in]ampmaxThe maximum allowed gradient amplitude ([G/cm])
[in]slewrateThe maximum allowed slewrate ([(G/cm) / us]). Value of 0.01 corresponds to 100 mT/m/s
Return values
STATUSSUCCESS or FAILURE
411  {
412  float minfov;
413  int tsp = 0;
414  float readpixelarea;
415  int nreadpixels;
416  float nonacq_readarea;
417  float ampmax_kspace_speedlimit;
418 
419  /* This function is for setting up readout trapezoid with fixed amplitude based on FOV and rBW */
420 
421  if (desc == NULL || desc[0] == ' ') {
422  return ks_error("ks_eval_readtrap: desc (2nd arg) cannot be NULL");
423  }
424  if (readtrap->acq.rbw == 0 || readtrap->acq.rbw == KS_NOTSET) {
425  return ks_error("ks_eval_readtrap: field 'acq.rbw' (1st arg) is not set");
426  }
427 
428  /* reset KS_TRAP's */
429  ks_init_trap(&readtrap->grad);
430  ks_init_trap(&readtrap->omega);
431 
432 
433  /* round rBW to nearest valid value */
434  readtrap->acq.rbw = ks_calc_nearestbw(readtrap->acq.rbw);
435  tsp = ks_calc_bw2tsp(readtrap->acq.rbw); /* us per sample point */
436 
437  minfov = ks_calc_minfov(ampmax, tsp);
438 
439  /* Programmer's error */
440  if (readtrap->res % 2 || readtrap->res <= 0 || readtrap->res > 2048) {
441  return ks_error("ks_eval_readtrap(%s): field 'res' must be even and in the range 2-2048", desc);
442  }
443  if (readtrap->fov < 10 || readtrap->fov > 600) {
444  return ks_error("ks_eval_readtrap(%s): field 'fov' must be in the range 10-600 mm", desc);
445  }
446  if (abs(readtrap->nover) > readtrap->res / 2) {
447  return ks_error("ks_eval_readtrap(%s): field 'nover' may not exceed res/2", desc);
448  }
449  if (readtrap->acq.rbw > 250) {
450  return ks_error("ks_eval_readtrap(%s): rBW cannot exceed +/- 250 kHz/FOV", desc);
451  }
452  /* Operator's error */
453  if (readtrap->fov < minfov && readtrap->rampsampling == 0) {
454  return ks_error("%s: Please increase the FOV to %.1f [cm] or decrease the rBW", desc, minfov / 10.0);
455  }
456 
457  if (abs(readtrap->nover)) {
458  nreadpixels = readtrap->res / 2 + abs(readtrap->nover);
459  } else {
460  nreadpixels = readtrap->res;
461  }
462  if (nreadpixels % 2) {
463  return ks_error("ks_eval_readtrap(%s): number of sampling points must be even (%d)", desc, nreadpixels);
464  }
465 
466 
467  if (readtrap->rampsampling == 1) { /* rampsampling */
468 
469  /* Gradient area necessary to move one pixel in k-space in the read direction */
470  readpixelarea = ks_calc_fov2gradareapixel(readtrap->fov); /* [(G/cm)*usec] */
471 
472  /* Speed limit the readout (i.e. put a cap on the readout amplitude) based on the FOV and the chosen rBW */
473  ampmax_kspace_speedlimit = FMin(2, readpixelarea / tsp, ampmax);
474 
475  /* delay of ACQ start relative to the beginning of the attack ramp.
476  For rampsampled cases, this value should be at least one dwell time (tsp) */
477  if (readtrap->acqdelay < 2 * tsp) {
478  readtrap->acqdelay = 2 * tsp;
479  }
480 
481  readtrap->acqdelay = RUP_FACTOR(readtrap->acqdelay, 2);
482 
483  /* gradient area before and after the acq window */
484  nonacq_readarea = slewrate /* [G/cm/usec] */ * (readtrap->acqdelay) * (readtrap->acqdelay) /* [usec^2] */; /* from both sides of the readout */
485 
486  /* required gradient area: gradient area needed during the acq window + nonacq_readarea */
487  readtrap->grad.area = (readpixelarea * nreadpixels) + nonacq_readarea;
488 
489  if (ks_eval_trap_constrained(&readtrap->grad, desc, ampmax_kspace_speedlimit, slewrate, 0) == FAILURE)
490  return FAILURE;
491 
492 
493  if (readtrap->grad.ramptime > readtrap->acqdelay) {
494  /* rampsampling attempt ok, continue calculating area2center and time2center */
495 
496  if (readtrap->nover > 0) { /* partial Fourier on the first part of the readout */
497  readtrap->area2center = readpixelarea * readtrap->nover + nonacq_readarea / 2;
498  } else { /* Full Fourier, or partial Fourier on the last part of the readout */
499  readtrap->area2center = readpixelarea * readtrap->res / 2 + nonacq_readarea / 2;
500  }
501 
502  /* area = (s*t^2)/2 [G/cm/usec] * [usec^2] */
503  if (readtrap->area2center < slewrate * (readtrap->grad.ramptime * readtrap->grad.ramptime / 2.0)) {
504  /* k-space center is on the attack ramp */
505  readtrap->time2center = (int) sqrt(readtrap->area2center * 2.0 / slewrate);
506  } else {
507  float arealeftonplateau = readtrap->area2center - (readtrap->grad.ramptime * readtrap->grad.amp / 2.0);
508  readtrap->time2center = (int) readtrap->grad.ramptime + (arealeftonplateau / readtrap->grad.amp); /* whole ramp + some plateau time */
509  }
510 
511  /* round up the readout window time to the nearest multiple of '2*tsp' to always make filt.outputs even */
512  readtrap->acq.duration = RUP_FACTOR(readtrap->grad.duration - readtrap->acqdelay * 2, (int) (2 * tsp));
513 
514  /* update 'acqdelay' due to this potential roundoff */
515  readtrap->acqdelay = (readtrap->grad.duration - readtrap->acq.duration) / 2;
516 
517  } else {
518 
519  readtrap->rampsampling = 0; /* let's skip ramp sampling then (and be caught by the next non-rampsampled case) */
520 
521  }
522 
523  } /* rampsampling */
524 
525 
526 
527 
528  if (readtrap->rampsampling == 0) { /* No rampsampling */
529 
530  if (desc[0] == ' ') {
531  ks_init_trap(&readtrap->grad);
532  return ks_error("ks_eval_readtrap: desc (2nd arg) cannot begin with a space");
533  } else {
534  strncpy(readtrap->grad.description, desc, KS_DESCRIPTION_LENGTH - 1);
535  readtrap->grad.description[KS_DESCRIPTION_LENGTH - 1] = 0;
536  }
537 
538  /* Error if requested constraints cannot be fullfilled */
539  if (readtrap->fov < minfov) {
540  return ks_error("%s: %s - Please increase the FOV to %.1f [cm] or decrease the rBW", __FUNCTION__, desc, minfov / 10.0);
541  }
542 
543  readtrap->grad.amp = ((float) (1.0 / (GAM * tsp * 1e-6) * (10.0 / readtrap->fov))); /* [G/cm] */
544  readtrap->grad.ramptime = RUP_GRD(readtrap->grad.amp / slewrate); /* [usec] */
545  readtrap->acq.duration = RUP_GRD(nreadpixels * tsp);
546 
547  /* adjust plateau time to account for padding */
548  const float ramparea = readtrap->grad.ramptime * readtrap->grad.amp / 2.0;
549  const float extradelay = RUP_GRD(FMax(2, readtrap->paddingarea - ramparea, 0.0) / readtrap->grad.amp);
550  readtrap->grad.plateautime = readtrap->acq.duration + 2*extradelay; /* [usec] */ /* Nkx * dwell time */
551 
552  readtrap->grad.duration = readtrap->grad.plateautime + readtrap->grad.ramptime * 2; /* [usec] */
553  readtrap->grad.area = (readtrap->grad.plateautime + readtrap->grad.ramptime) * readtrap->grad.amp; /* rounding effects */
554 
555  /* ACQ starts after the attack ramp */
556  readtrap->acqdelay = readtrap->grad.ramptime + extradelay;
557 
558  const int pixelstocenter = readtrap->nover > 0 ?
559  readtrap->nover : /* partial Fourier on the first part of the readout */
560  readtrap->res/2; /* Full Fourier, or partial Fourier on the last part of the readout */
561 
562  readtrap->area2center = (readtrap->grad.ramptime/2 + tsp * pixelstocenter + extradelay) * readtrap->grad.amp;
563  readtrap->time2center = readtrap->grad.ramptime + tsp * pixelstocenter + extradelay;
564 
565  } /* no rampsampling */
566 
567 
568 
569 
570  /* round up to nearest multiple of GRAD_UPDATE_TIME (4us) */
571  readtrap->time2center = RUP_GRD(readtrap->time2center);
572 
573 
574  /* setup acq window */
575  /* readtrap->acq.rbw is set > 0 by the calling function */
576  KS_DESCRIPTION read_description;
577  sprintf(read_description, "%s.echo", readtrap->grad.description);
578  if (ks_eval_read(&readtrap->acq, read_description) == FAILURE) {
579  return FAILURE;
580  }
581 
582  /* for rampsampling, create an omega waveform (for FOV shifts in the freq (read) direction for rampsampling) */
583  if (readtrap->rampsampling) {
584  readtrap->omega = readtrap->grad; /* copy the shape of the readout */
585  readtrap->omega.amp = 1.0; /* just unity value for conformance. It does not matter during scanning, since ks_scan_omegatrap_hz() ignores this value */
586  readtrap->omega.area = 0.0; /* Omega area has no meaning */
587  sprintf(readtrap->omega.description, "%s.omega", readtrap->grad.description);
588  } else {
589  readtrap->omega.duration = 0;
590  }
591 
592 
593  return SUCCESS;
594 }
KS_TRAP::plateautime
int plateautime
Definition: KSFoundation.h:436
ks_calc_nearestbw
float ks_calc_nearestbw(float bw)
Round receiver bandwidth to nearest valid value
Definition: KSFoundation_host.c:3385

Calculates the gradient area needed to move one pixel in k-space
Definition: KSFoundation_common.c:279
KS_NOTSET
#define KS_NOTSET
Definition: KSFoundation.h:60

float ks_calc_minfov(float ampmax, int tsp)
Calculates the minimum readout FOV
Definition: KSFoundation_common.c:252
ks_error
STATUS ks_error(const char *format,...) __attribute__((format(printf
Common error message function for HOST and TGT
ks_init_trap
void ks_init_trap(KS_TRAP *trap)
Resets a KS_TRAP sequence object to its default value (KS_INIT_TRAP)
Definition: KSFoundation_host.c:45

float fov

Convert receiver bandwidth to dwell time

Definition: KSFoundation.h:435

◆ ks_eval_readtrap()

STATUS ks_eval_readtrap ( KS_READTRAP *  readtrap,
const char *const  desc 
)

Sets up an acquisition window with a trapezoid with preset gradient constraints

This is a wrapper function to ks_eval_readtrap_constrained() with gradient constraints set to allow this KS_READTRAP to simultaneously be played on XGRAD, YGRAD, ZGRAD for any slice angulation. This is the generic and safest configuration, but for readouts with small FOV and high rBW, the gradient limits may be reached, especially for double oblique slices. See ks_eval_readtrap_constrained() for details on fields that need to be set before calling this function.

Parameters
[in,out]readtrapPointer to the KS_READTRAP object to be set up
[in]descA description (text string) of the KS_READTRAP object. This description is used for pulse sequence generation (seen in the file generated by TimeHist in MGD Sim/WTools)
Return values
STATUSSUCCESS or FAILURE
599  {
600 
601  return ks_eval_readtrap_constrained(readtrap, desc,
602  ks_syslimits_ampmax(loggrd), ks_syslimits_slewrate(loggrd));
603 
604 }
ks_syslimits_ampmax
float ks_syslimits_ampmax(LOG_GRAD loggrd)
Returns the maximum gradient amplitude that can be used on all gradient boards simultaneously
Definition: KSFoundation_common.c:163
ks_eval_readtrap_constrained
STATUS ks_eval_readtrap_constrained(KS_READTRAP *readtrap, const char *const desc, float ampmax, float slewrate)
Sets up an acquisition window with a trapezoid, subject to gradient constraints specified as input ar...
Definition: KSFoundation_host.c:411
loggrd
LOG_GRAD loggrd
ks_syslimits_slewrate
float ks_syslimits_slewrate(LOG_GRAD loggrd)
Returns the maximum slewrate that can be used on all gradient boards simultaneously
Definition: KSFoundation_common.c:196

◆ ks_eval_readtrap2()

STATUS ks_eval_readtrap2 ( KS_READTRAP *  readtrap,
const char *const  desc 
)

Sets up an acquisition window with a trapezoid with preset gradient constraints

This is a wrapper function to ks_eval_readtrap_constrained() with gradient constraints set to allow this KS_TRAP to simultaneously be played on up to two (2) logical gradients for any slice angulation. For double oblique slice angulations, this function will allow for smaller FOVs and higher rBWs than ks_eval_readtrap().

See ks_eval_readtrap_constrained() for details on fields that need to be set before calling this function.

Parameters
[in,out]readtrapPointer to the KS_READTRAP object to be set up
[in]descA description (text string) of the KS_READTRAP object. This description is used for pulse sequence generation (seen in the file generated by TimeHist in MGD Sim/WTools)
Return values
STATUSSUCCESS or FAILURE
607  {
608 
609  return ks_eval_readtrap_constrained(readtrap, desc,
610  ks_syslimits_ampmax2(loggrd), ks_syslimits_slewrate2(loggrd));
611 
612 }

◆ ks_eval_readtrap1()

STATUS ks_eval_readtrap1 ( KS_READTRAP *  readtrap,
const char *const  desc 
)

Sets up an acquisition window with a trapezoid with preset gradient constraints

This is a wrapper function to ks_eval_readtrap_constrained() with gradient constraints set to allow this KS_TRAP to only be played out on one (1) logical gradient at a time. No gradient may be active on another board while this trapezoid is played out. For double oblique slice angulations, this function will allow for smaller FOVs and higher rBWs than ks_eval_readtrap() and ks_eval_readtrap2(). See ks_eval_readtrap_constrained() for details on fields that need to be set before calling this function.

Parameters
[in,out]readtrapPointer to the KS_READTRAP object to be set up
[in]descA description (text string) of the KS_READTRAP object. This description is used for pulse sequence generation (seen in the file generated by TimeHist in MGD Sim/WTools)
Return values
STATUSSUCCESS or FAILURE
614  {
615 
616  return ks_eval_readtrap_constrained(readtrap, desc,
617  ks_syslimits_ampmax1(loggrd), ks_syslimits_slewrate1(loggrd));
618 
619 }

◆ ks_eval_phaseviewtable()

void ks_eval_phaseviewtable ( KS_PHASER *  phaser)

Sets up which lines to acquire for a KS_PHASER object

This function sets the following fields in a KS_PHASER object

  1. .numlinestoacq: Number of phase encoding lines to acquire
  2. .linetoacq[]: Array, where the first .numlinestoacq elements denotes which lines to acquire with indices corresponding to a fully sampled k-space. The top-most line has index 0 and the bottom-most line has index (.res-1).

These two fields are set based on .res, .nover, .nacslines, and .R in the KS_PHASER object. If .nover < 0, partial Fourier will be set up, but with flipped k-space coverage

Parameters
[in,out]phaserPointer to the KS_PHASER object to be set up
Returns
void
624  {
625  int i, index, firstline, lastline, halfacslines;
626  short viewonflag[1025];
627 
628  /* reset arrays */
629  for (i = 0; i < KS_MAX_PHASEDYN; i++) {
630  phaser->linetoacq[i] = 0;
631  viewonflag[i] = 0;
632  }
633 
634  if (phaser->nover == 0) {
635  firstline = 0;
636  lastline = phaser->res - 1;
637  } else if (phaser->nover > 0) { /* fractional ky upper half */
638  firstline = 0;
639  lastline = phaser->res / 2 + phaser->nover - 1;
640  } else {
641  firstline = phaser->res / 2 + phaser->nover; /* NOTE: phase->nover here negative ! */
642  lastline = phaser->res - 1;
643  }
644 
645  if ((lastline - firstline + 1) % 2) {
646  /* /vobs/vre/recon/rcapps/rc_filter.cpp requires that rhdayres is odd (according to ARC.e) */
647  ks_error("%s: #k-space lines *spanned* must be even",__FUNCTION__);
648  }
649 
650 
651  /* lower half of k-space: mark the lines to acquire with '1' */
652  halfacslines = phaser->nacslines / 2;
653  for (i = (phaser->res / 2); i <= lastline; i++) {
654  if (((i + 1) % phaser->R) == 1 || phaser->R == 1) {
655  viewonflag[i] = 1;
656  } else if (halfacslines > 0) {
657  viewonflag[i] = 1;
658  halfacslines--;
659  }
660  }
661 
662  /* upper half of k-space: mark the lines to acquire with '1' */
663  halfacslines = phaser->nacslines - (phaser->nacslines / 2) + halfacslines;
664  for (i = (phaser->res / 2) - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
665  if (((i + 1) % phaser->R) == 1 || phaser->R == 1) {
666  viewonflag[i] = 1;
667  } else if (halfacslines > 0) {
668  viewonflag[i] = 1;
669  halfacslines--;
670  }
671  }
672 
673  /* sweep kspace linearly and save the line numbers to acquire.
674  firstline/lastline handles full/partial Fourier */
675  index = 0;
676  for (i = firstline; i <= lastline; i++) {
677  if (viewonflag[i]) {
678  phaser->linetoacq[index++] = i;
679  }
680  }
681  phaser->numlinestoacq = index;
682 
683 }
KS_PHASER::R
int R
Definition: KSFoundation.h:1529
KS_PHASER::res
int res
Definition: KSFoundation.h:1527
KS_PHASER::nacslines
int nacslines
Definition: KSFoundation.h:1530
ks_error
STATUS ks_error(const char *format,...) __attribute__((format(printf
Common error message function for HOST and TGT
KS_PHASER::numlinestoacq
int numlinestoacq
Definition: KSFoundation.h:1532
Indices::i
int32_t i
Definition: KSFoundation_tgt.c:1302
KS_PHASER::linetoacq
int linetoacq[KS_MAX_PHASEDYN]
Definition: KSFoundation.h:1533
KS_PHASER::nover
int nover
Definition: KSFoundation.h:1528
KS_MAX_PHASEDYN
#define KS_MAX_PHASEDYN
Definition: KSFoundation.h:118

◆ ks_eval_phaser_adjustres()

STATUS ks_eval_phaser_adjustres ( KS_PHASER *  phaser,
const char *const  desc 
)

Adjusts the phase encoding resolution to the nearest valid value

Phase resolution must be divisible by .R and be even, and there are additional requirements for partial ky Fourier scans. Moreover, for parallel imaging using ASSET, only the acquired lines are stored in the data (compressed BAM), resulting in an R times lower value for rhnframes.

Here are the rules:

  • Resolution (and overscan) choice must guarantee that (rhhnover + rhnframes) is an even number
  • Full Fourier, ASSET:
    • rhnframes = res / R
    • rhhnover = 0
    • => res / R must be even
  • Partial Fourier:
    • rhnframes = (res / 2) / R
    • rhhnover = overscans/R
    • => res / (2 * R) and (res / (2 * R) + overscans) must be even
      • overscans/R and (res/2)/R must be integers
      • => res must be divisible by (4 * R)
      • => overscans must be divisible by (2 * R)
Parameters
[in,out]phaserPointer to KS_PHASER
[in]descA description (text string) of the KS_PHASER object, only used for error msg
Return values
STATUSSUCCESS or FAILURE
687  {
688 
689  int kspacelines_noacc;
690 
691  if (phaser->nover == 0)
692  kspacelines_noacc = phaser->res;
693  else
694  kspacelines_noacc = phaser->res / 2 + abs(phaser->nover);
695 
696  if (kspacelines_noacc < phaser->R) {
697  /* Number of k-space lines less than R */
698  return ks_error("%s(%s): R cannot exceed %d", __FUNCTION__, desc, kspacelines_noacc);
699  } else if (kspacelines_noacc == phaser->R) {
700  /* Number of k-space lines equal to R. Used for EPI when R is used as shots to produce ETL = 1.
701  Just make sure that res is even */
702  if (phaser->res % 2) {
703  return ks_error("%s(%s): res must be even", __FUNCTION__, desc);
704  } else {
705  return SUCCESS;
706  }
707  }
708 
709  if (phaser->nover != 0) {
710  /* partial Fourier */
711  const int sign_nover = (phaser->nover >= 0) ? 1 : -1;
712  phaser->nover = abs(phaser->nover);
713  int invalidnover = TRUE;
714 
715  /* round res and nover to nearest valid values */
716  if (phaser->R % 2) { /* R is odd */
717  phaser->res = RUP_FACTOR(phaser->res - 2 * phaser->R, 4 * phaser->R);
718  phaser->nover = RUP_FACTOR(phaser->nover - phaser->R, 2 * phaser->R) * sign_nover;
719  invalidnover = phaser->nover < (2 * phaser->R) || phaser->nover > (phaser->res / 2);
720  } else { /* R is even */
721  phaser->res = RUP_FACTOR(phaser->res - phaser->R, 2 * phaser->R);
722  phaser->nover = RUP_FACTOR(phaser->nover - phaser->R/2, phaser->R) * sign_nover;
723  invalidnover = phaser->nover < phaser->R || phaser->nover > (phaser->res / 2);
724  }
725 
726  if (invalidnover) {
727  return ks_error("%s(%s): Valid #overscans not found", __FUNCTION__, desc);
728  }
729 
730  } else {
731  /* full Fourier */
732 
733  phaser->res = RUP_FACTOR(phaser->res - phaser->R, 2 * phaser->R);
734 
735  }
736 
737  return SUCCESS;
738 }
KS_PHASER::R
int R
Definition: KSFoundation.h:1529
KS_PHASER::res
int res
Definition: KSFoundation.h:1527
ks_error
STATUS ks_error(const char *format,...) __attribute__((format(printf
Common error message function for HOST and TGT
KS_PHASER::nover
int nover
Definition: KSFoundation.h:1528

◆ ks_eval_phaser_setaccel()

STATUS ks_eval_phaser_setaccel ( KS_PHASER *  phaser,
int  min_acslines,
float  R 
)

[ks_eval_phaser_setaccel description]

Parameters
[in,out]phaserPointer to KS_PHASER
[in]min_acslinesMinimum # of ACS lines
[in]R(floating point) acceleration (taken e.g. from the UI opaccel_ph_stride)
Return values
STATUSSUCCESS or FAILURE
743  {
744 
745  if (R <= 1.0) {
746  phaser->R = 1.0;
747  phaser->nacslines = 0;
748  return SUCCESS;
749  }
750 
751  /* Get integer acceleration and store the Rfraction for ARC mode */
752  double Rfraction = ceil(R) - R;
753  if (Rfraction > 0.9999) { /* handle roundoff issues for e.g. R=2.0000001 */
754  Rfraction = 0.0;
755  }
756  phaser->R = floor(R + Rfraction + 0.5); /* round-up R to nearest integer */
757 
758  if (min_acslines == 0) {
759  /* ASSET mode */
760 
761  /* phaser.nacslines = 0 triggers ASSET scan mode in GEReq_predownload_setrecon_accel() */
762  phaser->nacslines = 0;
763 
764  } else {
765  /* ARC mode */
766 
767  double totlines_spanned = (phaser->nover != 0) ? (phaser->res / 2 + abs(phaser->nover)) : phaser->res;
768  double acqlines_R = totlines_spanned / phaser->R;
769  double acqlines_floorR = totlines_spanned / FMax(2, 1.0, floor(R));
770 
771  /* adapt #acs lines based on the fraction of the acceleration factor, but never go below min_acslines */
772  phaser->nacslines = IMax(2, (int) ((acqlines_floorR - acqlines_R) * Rfraction), min_acslines);
773 
774  }
775 
776  return SUCCESS;
777 }
KS_PHASER::R
int R
Definition: KSFoundation.h:1529
KS_PHASER::res
int res
Definition: KSFoundation.h:1527
KS_PHASER::nacslines
int nacslines
Definition: KSFoundation.h:1530
KS_PHASER::nover
int nover
Definition: KSFoundation.h:1528

◆ ks_eval_phaser_constrained()

STATUS ks_eval_phaser_constrained ( KS_PHASER *  phaser,
const char *const  desc,
float  ampmax,
float  slewrate,
int  minplateautime 
)

Sets up a trapezoid for phase encoding, subject to gradient constraints specified as input arguments

Before calling this function, the following fields in KS_PHASER must be set up:

  1. .fov: The desired image Field-of-View (FOV) in [mm] along the sequence board one intends to place the KS_PHASER on (typically YGRAD, for 3D also ZGRAD)
  2. .res: The number of pixels within the FOV
  3. .nover: Number of 'overscans'. If 0, a full-Fourier k-space will be set up. If > 0, partial Fourier will be set up (shorter scan time) where .nover number of extra k-space lines beyond .res/2. If < 0, partial Fourier will be set up, but with flipped k-space coverage. The total number of samples will be .res/2 + abs(.nover). Absolute values of .nover between 1 and about 16 should be avoided since half Fourier reconstruction methods will likely have difficulties
  4. .R: The parallel imaging acceleration factor
  5. .nacslines: If .R > 1, the value of .nacslines is the number of calibration lines around k-space center for parallel imaging calibration
  6. .areaoffset: It is possible to embed a static gradient area in the phase encoding functionality of KS_PHASER. This is useful for 3D imaging, where the area needed for the rephaser for the slice select gradient can be put into .areaoffset. This makes the KS_PHASER to act as both slice rephaser and slice phase encoding gradient, which can shorten TE

If the KS_PHASER object is initialized with KS_INIT_PHASER, .nover, .nacslines and .areaoffset will be zero, and .R will be 1 (steps 3-6 can be skipped)

Based on the information in the KS_PHASER object, ks_eval_phaser_constrained() will set up the .grad trapezoid (KS_TRAP). By internally calling ks_eval_phaseviewtable(), .numlinestoacq, and the array .linetoacq[] are also set up. The field .numlinestoacq is an integer corresponding to the actual number of lines to acquire, and also the number of elements to read in .linetoacq[], containing the complete list of phase encoding lines to acquire (honoring partial Fourier, parallel imaging acceleration and ACS lines)

If ks_eval_phaser_constrained() returns FAILURE, one must also make sure cveval() returns FAILURE, otherwise an error message created in ks_eval_phaser_constrained() will not be seen in the UI

There are three wrapper functions to this function (ks_eval_phaser(), ks_eval_phaser1(), ks_eval_phaser2()) that have reduced number of input arguments, and calls ks_eval_phaser_constrained() with different preset gradient constraints. ks_eval_phaser() makes fewest assumptions, making it the most general choice

Parameters
[in,out]phaserPointer to the KS_PHASER object to be set up
[in]descA description (text string) of the KS_PHASER object. This description is used for pulse sequence generation (seen in the file generated by TimeHist in MGD Sim/WTools)
[in]ampmaxThe maximum allowed gradient amplitude ([G/cm])
[in]slewrateThe maximum allowed slewrate ([(G/cm) / us]). Value of 0.01 corresponds to 100 mT/m/s
[in]minplateautimeThe minimum plateau time of the trapezoid ([us])
Return values
STATUSSUCCESS or FAILURE
784  {
785  float phasepixelarea;
786 
787  ks_init_trap(&phaser->grad);
788 
789  if (phaser->fov < 5 || phaser->fov > 600) {
790  return ks_error("%s(%s): field 'fov' must be in the range 5-600 mm", __FUNCTION__, phasername);
791  }
792 
793  /* adjust res and possibly nover to allow both ARC and ASSET scans with full and partial ky Fourier */
794  if (ks_eval_phaser_adjustres(phaser, phasername) == FAILURE) {
795  return FAILURE;
796  }
797 
798  phasepixelarea = ks_calc_fov2gradareapixel(phaser->fov); /* [(G/cm)*usec] */
799 
800  /* area required to reach the outermost phase encoding step (incl. areaoffset)
801  N.B.: The *sign* of the area is controlled in scan using ks_scan_phaser_toline(), hence on HOST all phase encoding gradient will be positive, unlike TGT */
802  phaser->grad.area = ((phaser->res - 1.0) / 2.0) * phasepixelarea + fabs(phaser->areaoffset); /* .areaoffset is used in 3D imaging to embed e.g. a slice sel. rephaser in the phase encoding gradient */
803 
804  /* setup phaser trap */
805  if (phaser->grad.area != 0.0) {
806  if (ks_eval_trap_constrained(&phaser->grad, phasername, ampmax, slewrate, minduration) == FAILURE)
807  return FAILURE;
808  }
809 
810  /* setup phaser->linetoacq[] */
811  ks_eval_phaseviewtable(phaser);
812 
813 
814  return SUCCESS;
815 
816 }
KS_PHASER::res
int res
Definition: KSFoundation.h:1527
KS_PHASER::grad
KS_TRAP grad
Definition: KSFoundation.h:1525

Calculates the gradient area needed to move one pixel in k-space

◆ ks_eval_phaser()

STATUS ks_eval_phaser ( KS_PHASER *  phaser,
const char *const  desc 
)

Sets up an acquisition window with a trapezoid with preset gradient constraints

This is a wrapper function to ks_eval_phaser_constrained() with gradient constraints set to allow this KS_PHASER to simultaneously be played on XGRAD, YGRAD, ZGRAD for any slice angulation. This is the generic and safest configuration, but the duration of the KS_PHASER object may increase for double oblique slices

See ks_eval_phaser_constrained() for details on fields that need to be set before calling this function

Parameters
[in,out]phaserPointer to the KS_PHASER object to be set up
[in]descA description (text string) of the KS_PHASER object. This description is used for pulse sequence generation (seen in the file generated by TimeHist in MGD Sim/WTools)
Return values
STATUSSUCCESS or FAILURE
821  {
822 
823  return ks_eval_phaser_constrained(phaser, phasername, ks_syslimits_ampmax(loggrd), ks_syslimits_slewrate(loggrd), 0);
824 
825 }

)

Sets up an acquisition window with a trapezoid with preset gradient constraints

This is a wrapper function to ks_eval_phaser_constrained() with gradient constraints set to allow this KS_PHASER to only be played out on one (1) logical gradient at a time. No gradient may be active on another board while this trapezoid is played out. ◆ ks_eval_wave()

STATUS ks_eval_wave ( KS_WAVE *  wave,
const char *const  desc,
int  res,
int  duration,
KS_WAVEFORM  waveform 
)

Sets up a KS_WAVE object based on a waveform (KS_WAVEFORM) in memory

ks_eval_wave() copies the content of a KS_WAVEFORM into a KS_WAVE sequence object. KS_WAVEFORM (5th arg) is a typedef for a float array with a fixed length of KS_MAXWAVELEN elements. Hence, a KS_WAVEFORM, or float array, must first be created and filled with some wave contents before calling this function. res elements are copied from the input KS_WAVEFORM to the field .waveform in the KS_WAVE object (1st arg). duration (4th arg) must be divisible by res (3rd arg) and at least 2x res.

When using (i.e. calling ks_pg_wave()) the waveform for:

  1. RF or OMEGA, nothing needs to be done in terms of amplitude scaling. For RF, amplitude scaling is handled via the KS_RF object, and for OMEGA the number of [Hz] are set directly in run-time (scan())
  2. THETA, the waveform needs to be scaled to units of [degrees]
  3. XGRAD, YGRAD, or ZGRAD, the waveform needs to be scaled to units of [G/cm]
Parameters
[out]waveKS_WAVE object to be created
[in]descA description (text string) of the KS_WAVE object. This description is used for pulse sequence generation (seen in the file generated by TimeHist in MGD Sim/WTools)
[in]resResolution of the waveform, i.e. number of elements from KS_WAVEFORM (5th arg) to read
[in]durationDesired duration in [us] of the waveform (must be divisible with res)
[in]waveformKS_WAVEFORM (float array of max length KS_MAXWAVELEN) with existing waveform content
Return values
STATUSSUCCESS or FAILURE
839  {
840  KS_DESCRIPTION tmpdesc;
841 
842  strncpy(tmpdesc, desc, KS_DESCRIPTION_LENGTH / 2);
843  /* don't allow NULL or a description with leading space */
844  if (desc == NULL || desc[0] == ' ') {
845  return ks_error("ks_eval_wave: wave name (2nd arg) cannot be NULL or leading space");
846  }
847 
848  if (duration < 0 || res < 0) {
849  return ks_error("ks_eval_wave(%s): 'res' and 'duration' must be positive", desc);
850  }
851  if (res > KS_MAXWAVELEN) {
852  return ks_error("ks_eval_wave(%s): 'res' cannot exceed %d", wave->description, KS_MAXWAVELEN);
853  }
854  if (res % 2) {
855  return ks_error("ks_eval_wave(%s): 'res' must be even", wave->description);
856  }
857  if (duration > 0 && (duration % res)) {
858  return ks_error("ks_eval_wave(%s): 'duration' (%d) [us] must be divisible by 'res' (%d)", desc, duration, res);
859  }
860  if (duration > 0 && (duration / res) < 2) {
861  return ks_error("ks_eval_wave(%s): 'duration' (%d) [us] must be at least 2x 'res' (%d)", desc, duration, res);
862  }
863 
864  /* reset wave object */
865  ks_init_wave(wave);
866 
867  /* fill in wave object */
868  strcpy(wave->description, tmpdesc);
869  wave->res = res;
870  wave->duration = duration;
871 
872  /* copy the waveform */
873  memcpy(wave->waveform, newwave, sizeof(float) * wave->res);
874 
875 
876 
877  return SUCCESS;
878 
879 }
ks_error
STATUS ks_error(const char *format,...) __attribute__((format(printf
Common error message function for HOST and TGT
KS_DESCRIPTION_LENGTH
#define KS_DESCRIPTION_LENGTH

◆ ks_eval_wave_file()

STATUS ks_eval_wave_file ( KS_WAVE *  wave,
const char *const  desc,
int  res,
int  duration,
const char *const  filename,
const char *const  format 
)

Sets up a KS_WAVE object based on a waveform that resides on disk

ks_eval_wave_file() reads waveforms on disk into a KS_WAVE. The data format (arg 6) may currently be one of:

  1. "GE": GE's file format for external pulses (.rho, .gz, etc.). The data will be divided by a factor of MAX_PG_WAMP (32766) before copied to KS_WAVE
  2. "short": Plain short integer format. The data will be divided by a factor of MAX_PG_WAMP (32766) before copied to KS_WAVE
  3. "float": Plain float format. Data will be read in as is and copied to KS_WAVE

When the first two formats are used the field .waveform in KS_WAVE will contain data in the range [-1.0,1.0]. res elements are read from disk in the specified format into the field .waveform in the KS_WAVE object (1st arg). duration (4th arg) must be divisible by res (3rd arg) and at least 2x res.

When using (i.e. calling ks_pg_wave()) the waveform for:

  1. RF or OMEGA, nothing needs to be done in terms of amplitude scaling. For RF, amplitude scaling is handled via the KS_RF object, and for OMEGA the number of [Hz] are set directly in run-time (scan())
  2. THETA, the waveform needs to be scaled to units of [degrees]
  3. XGRAD, YGRAD, or ZGRAD, the waveform needs to be scaled to units of [G/cm]
Parameters
[out]waveKS_WAVE object to be created
[in]descA description (text string) of the KS_WAVE object. This description is used for pulse sequence generation (seen in the file generated by TimeHist in MGD Sim/WTools)
[in]resKS_WAVE object to be created
[in]durationKS_WAVE object to be created
[in]filenameFilename on disk
[in]formatString denoting the data format on disk. Valid values are: "ge" (reads GE's *.rho files with 32byte header), "short", and "float", the latter two being header-less
Return values
STATUSSUCCESS or FAILURE
882  {
883  KS_DESCRIPTION tmpdesc;
884  int i;
885 
886  strncpy(tmpdesc, desc, KS_DESCRIPTION_LENGTH / 2);
887  /* don't allow empty description or a description with leading space */
888  if (desc == NULL || desc[0] == ' ') {
889  return ks_error("ks_eval_wave_file: wave name (2nd arg) cannot be NULL or leading space");
890  }
891  if (res % 2) {
892  return ks_error("ks_eval_wave_file(%s): 'res' must be even", wave->description);
893  }
894  if (duration > 0 && (duration % res)) {
895  return ks_error("ks_eval_wave_file(%s): 'duration' (%d) [us] must be divisible by 'res' (%d)", desc, duration, res);
896  }
897  if (duration > 0 && (duration / res) < 2) {
898  return ks_error("ks_eval_wave_file(%s): 'duration' (%d) [us] must be at least 2x 'res' (%d)", desc, duration, res);
899  }
900  if (duration < 0 || duration > 4 * KS_MAXWAVELEN) {
901  return ks_error("ks_eval_wave_file(%s): 'duration' [us] must be in the range [0, %d]", desc, 4 * KS_MAXWAVELEN);
902  }
903 
904  /* reset wave object */
905  ks_init_wave(wave);
906 
907  /* fill in wave object */
908  strcpy(wave->description, tmpdesc);
909  wave->res = res;
910  wave->duration = duration;
911 
912  /* read from file */
913  if (!strncasecmp(format, "ge", 2)) { /* short format with 32-byte header and big-endian short int */
914  KS_IWAVE iwave;
915  uextwave(iwave, res, (char *) filename);
916  for (i = 0; i < res; i++)
917  wave->waveform[i] = (float) iwave[i] / (float) MAX_PG_WAMP;
918  } else if (!strncasecmp(format, "short", 5)) {
919  KS_IWAVE iwave;
920  FILE *fp;
921  int n;
922  if ((fp = fopen(filename, "r")) == NULL)
923  return ks_error("ks_eval_wave_file (%s): Error opening file '%s'", wave->description, filename);
924  if ((n = fread(iwave, sizeof(short), res, fp)) < res)
925  return ks_error("ks_eval_wave_file (%s): Only %d out of %d elements read from file '%s'", wave->description, n, res, filename);
926  fclose(fp);
927  for (i = 0; i < res; i++)
928  wave->waveform[i] = (float) iwave[i] / (float) MAX_PG_WAMP;
929  } else if (!strncasecmp(format, "float", 5)) {
930  FILE *fp;
931  int n;
932  if ((fp = fopen(filename, "r")) == NULL)
933  return ks_error("ks_eval_wave_file (%s): Error opening file '%s'", wave->description, filename);
934  if ((n = fread(wave->waveform, sizeof(float), res, fp)) < res)
935  return ks_error("ks_eval_wave_file (%s): Only %d out of %d elements read from file '%s'", wave->description, n, res, filename);
936  fclose(fp);
937  } else {
938  return ks_error("ks_eval_wave_file (%s): 'format' (5th arg) must be 'ge','short' or 'float'", wave->description);
939  }
940 
941 
942  return SUCCESS;
943 
944 } /* ks_eval_wave_file */
KS_IWAVE
short KS_IWAVE[KS_MAXWAVELEN]
Definition: KSFoundation.h:180
ks_error
STATUS ks_error(const char *format,...) __attribute__((format(printf
Common error message function for HOST and TGT
Indices::i
int32_t i
Definition: KSFoundation_tgt.c:1302
KS_DESCRIPTION_LENGTH
#define KS_DESCRIPTION_LENGTH
Definition: KSFoundation.h:112

KS_DESCRIPTION description
Definition: KSFoundation.h:516

Resets a KS_WAVE sequence object to its default value (KS_INIT_WAVE)

KS_MAXWAVELEN

Definition: KSFoundation.h:113

◆ ks_eval_mirrorwave()

STATUS ks_eval_mirrorwave ( KS_WAVE *  wave)

Flips the contents of the KS_WAVEFORM in a KS_WAVE object

ks_eval_mirrorwave() replaces the KS_WAVEFORM with its (temporally) mirrored version. This can be used to e.g. mirror a minimum phase excitation pulse for fast recovery and T1-optimization in FSE sequences (ksfse.e).#pragma endregion See also ks_eval_stretch_rf().

Parameters
[in,out]waveKS_WAVE object, whose KS_WAVEFORM to be mirrored
Return values
STATUSSUCCESS or FAILURE
948  {
949  KS_WAVEFORM tmpwave;
950  int i;
951 
952  memcpy(tmpwave, wave->waveform, sizeof(float) * wave->res);
953 
954  for (i = 0; i < wave->res; i++) {
955  wave->waveform[i] = tmpwave[wave->res-1 - i];
956  }
957  return SUCCESS;
958 
959  return SUCCESS;
960 }
Indices::i
int32_t i
Definition: KSFoundation_tgt.c:1302
KS_WAVEFORM
float KS_WAVEFORM[KS_MAXWAVELEN]
Definition: KSFoundation.h:179

int res
Definition: KSFoundation.h:517
KS_WAVE::waveform
KS_WAVEFORM waveform

◆ ks_eval_rf_sinc()

STATUS ks_eval_rf_sinc ( KS_RF *  rf,
const char *const  desc,
double  bw,
double  tbw,
float  flip,
int  wintype 
)

Sets up a KS_RF object with a Sinc pulse shape

For small flip angles, the Fourier transform of the RF envelope is a good approximation of the final slice profile and SLR designed pulses may not be necessary. For these cases, this function can be used to create a Sinc RF pulse (as a KS_RF object) with a desired bandwidth (BW), time-bandwidth-product (TBW) and window function (e.g. KS_RF_SINCWIN_HAMMING, see ks_enum_sincwin). An increased TBW results in more Sinc lobes and sharper slice profiles, and the minimum value is 2. The duration of the RF pulse (.rfwave.duration) increases when BW decreases or TBW increases

Parameters
[out]rfKS_RF object to be created
[in]descA description (text string) of the KS_RF object. This description is used for pulse sequence generation (seen in the file generated by TimeHist in MGD Sim/WTools)
[in]bwBandwidth of the RF pulse [Hz]
[in]tbwTime-bandwidth-product of the RF pulse. Higher value gives sharper slice profiles but increases the duration
[in]flipNominal flip angle of the RF pulse
[in]wintypeWindow function over the Sinc. See ks_enum_sincwin for enums names that steer the window choice
Return values
STATUSSUCCESS or FAILURE
971  {
972  KS_DESCRIPTION tmpdesc;
973  int i;
974  double x, window, rfenvelope;
975  int duration = RUP_GRD(tbw / bw * 1e6); /* [us]. We round up to nearest multiple of 4 (GRAD_UPDATE_TIME) to better align to gradients */
976  int res = duration / RF_UPDATE_TIME; /* # sample points. RF_UPDATE_TIME = 2 => res always even */
977 
978  /* don't allow empty description or a description with leading space */
979  if (desc == NULL || desc[0] == ' ') {
980  return ks_error("ks_eval_rf_sinc: RF name (2nd arg) cannot be NULL or leading space");
981  }
982  strncpy(tmpdesc, desc, KS_DESCRIPTION_LENGTH/2);
983  tmpdesc[KS_DESCRIPTION_LENGTH/2] = 0;
984 
985  /* reset RF object */
986  ks_init_rf(rf);
987 
988  /* fill in wave object */
989  sprintf(rf->rfwave.description, "%s.wave", tmpdesc);
990 
991  if (bw < 2 || bw > 100000) {
992  return ks_error("ks_eval_rf_sinc(%s): 'bw' (%g, 3rd arg) must be in range [2,100000] Hz", rf->rfwave.description, bw);
993  }
994  if (tbw < 2 || tbw > 100) {
995  return ks_error("ks_eval_rf_sinc(%s): 'tbw' (%g, 4th arg) must be in range [2,100]", rf->rfwave.description, tbw);
996  }
997  if (res > KS_MAXWAVELEN || res < 4) {
998  return ks_error("ks_eval_rf_sinc(%s): combination of 'bw' and 'tbw' resulted in a resolution outside the valid range [4, %d]", rf->rfwave.description, KS_MAXWAVELEN);
999  }
1000  if (flip <= 0 || flip > 10000.0) {
1001  return ks_error("ks_eval_rf_sinc(%s): 'flip' must be in range (0, 10000]", rf->rfwave.description);
1002  }
1003 
1004  rf->rfwave.res = res;
1005  rf->rfwave.duration = duration;
1006  rf->iso2end = duration / 2;
1007  rf->start2iso = duration / 2;
1008  rf->bw = bw;
1009  rf->flip = flip;
1010 
1011  /* generate waveform with max 1.0 */
1012  for (i = 0 ; i < (res - 1) ; i++) {
1013  x = 2.0 * i / (res - 1) - 1.0;
1014 
1015  if (fabs(2.0 * PI * (tbw / 4.0)*x) > 1e-6) {
1016  rfenvelope = sin(2.0 * PI * (tbw / 4.0) * x) / (2.0 * PI * (tbw / 4.0) * x);
1017  } else {
1018  rfenvelope = 1.0;
1019  }
1020 
1021  window = 1.0; /* init to no filter */
1022 
1023  if (wintype == KS_RF_SINCWIN_HAMMING) {
1024  window = 0.54 + 0.46 * cos(PI * x);
1025  } else if (wintype == KS_RF_SINCWIN_HANNING) {
1026  window = (1.0 + cos(PI * x)) * 0.5;
1027  } else if (wintype == KS_RF_SINCWIN_BLACKMAN) {
1028  window = 0.42 + 0.5 * cos(PI * x) + 0.08 * cos(2 * PI * x);
1029  } else if (wintype == KS_RF_SINCWIN_BARTLETT) {
1030  if (x < 0.0)
1031  window = x + 1.0;
1032  else
1033  window = 1.0 - x;
1034  }
1035 
1036  rf->rfwave.waveform[i] = rfenvelope * window;
1037 
1038  } /* for */
1039 
1040  /* initialize amplitude to 1 */
1041  rf->amp = 1;
1042 
1043  /* set the usage of the RF PULSE to off until .base.ninst > 0 (see ks_pg_rf() on HOST) */
1044  rf->rfpulse.activity = PSD_PULSE_OFF;
1045 
1046  /* initialize number of occurrences of RF pulse to zero */
1047  rf->rfpulse.num = 0;
1048 
1049  /* setup rfpulse structure */
1050  return ks_eval_rfstat(rf);
1051 }
KS_RF::start2iso
int start2iso
Definition: KSFoundation.h:793
KS_RF_SINCWIN_HAMMING
Definition: KSFoundation.h:1751
KS_RF::rfpulse
RF_PULSE rfpulse
Definition: KSFoundation.h:797

float flip

◆ ks_eval_rf_secant()

STATUS ks_eval_rf_secant ( KS_RF *  rf,
const char *const  desc,
float  A0,
float  tbw,
float  bw 
)

Sets up a KS_RF object with a Hyperbolic Secant shape

1055  {
1056  STATUS status;
1057  int debug = 1;
1058 
1059  /* reset RF object */
1060  ks_init_rf(rf);
1061 
1062  KS_DESCRIPTION tmpdesc;
1063  int i;
1064 
1065  /* don't allow empty description or a description with leading space */
1066  if (desc == NULL || desc[0] == ' ') {
1067  return ks_error("ks_eval_rf_secant: 'RF name' (2nd arg) cannot be NULL or leading space");
1068  }
1069  strncpy(tmpdesc, desc, KS_DESCRIPTION_LENGTH/2);
1070  tmpdesc[KS_DESCRIPTION_LENGTH/2] = 0;
1071 
1072  /* fill in wave object */
1073  sprintf(rf->rfwave.description, "%s.wave", tmpdesc);
1074 
1075  if (A0 < 0 || 0.25 < A0) {
1076  return ks_error("ks_eval_rf_secant(%s): 'A0' (%g, 3rd arg) must be in range [0,0.25] Gauss", rf->rfwave.description, A0);
1077  }
1078  if (tbw < 2 || 20 < tbw) {
1079  return ks_error("ks_eval_rf_secant(%s): 'tbw' (%g, 4th arg) must be in range [2,20]", rf->rfwave.description, tbw);
1080  }
1081  if (bw < 100 || 10000 < bw) {
1082  return ks_error("ks_eval_rf_secant(%s): 'bw' (%g, 5th arg) must be in range [0,10000] Hz", rf->rfwave.description, bw);
1083  }
1084 
1085  int duration = RUP_GRD((int)(1000000.0 * tbw / bw));
1086  int res = duration / GRAD_UPDATE_TIME; /* # sample points. RF_UPDATE_TIME = 2 => res always even */
1087 
1088  if (res < 4 || KS_MAXWAVELEN < res) {
1089  return ks_error("ks_eval_rf_secant(%s): tbw / bw resulted in a resolution(%d)/duration(%d) outside the valid range [4, %d]", rf->rfwave.description, res, duration, KS_MAXWAVELEN);
1090  }
1091 
1092  rf->rfwave.res = res;
1093  rf->rfwave.duration = duration;
1094  rf->iso2end = duration / 2;
1095  rf->start2iso = duration / 2;
1096 
1097  /* calculate pulse properties */
1098  float y = 5; /* 5 is a standard value from literature */
1099  float B = (bw * PI) / y;
1100  float Acheck = (PI * bw) / (2.0 * PI * 4258 * sqrt(y)); /* Gauss */
1101 
1102  if (Acheck > A0 * 0.5) {
1103  return ks_error("ks_eval_rf_secant(%s): The adiabatic condition might not be met since %g !>> %g (needs to be at least half)", rf->rfwave.description, A0, Acheck);
1104  }
1105 
1106  rf->bw = bw;
1107  rf->flip = 180.0;
1108 
1109  double rfenvelope, phaseenvelope, tau, sech;
1110  for (i = 0 ; i < res; i++) {
1111 
1112  /* range from -2pi to 2pi */
1113  tau = ((i / (((float)res - 1.0) * 0.5)) - 1.0) * 2.0 * PI;
1114 
1115  sech = 1.0 / cosh(tau * B * 0.001);
1116  rfenvelope = A0 * sech;
1117  phaseenvelope = y * log(sech) + y * log(A0);
1118 
1119  rf->rfwave.waveform[i] = rfenvelope;
1120  rf->thetawave.waveform[i] = phaseenvelope * (180.0/PI);
1121 
1122  }
1123 
1124  if (debug == 1) {
1125  ks_print_waveform(rf->rfwave.waveform, "secant_a.txt", rf->rfwave.res);
1126  ks_print_waveform(rf->thetawave.waveform, "secant_p.txt", rf->rfwave.res);
1127  ks_error("HS: A0=%f >> Ac=%f, bw=%f, tbw=%f", A0, Acheck, bw, tbw);
1128  ks_error("HS: y=%f, B=%f", y, B);
1129  }
1130 
1131  /* Normalize waveform to one & initialize amplitude to 1 */
1132  ks_wave_multiplyval(&rf->rfwave, 1.0 / ks_wave_absmax(&rf->rfwave));
1133  rf->amp = 1;
1134 
1135  /* set the usage of the RF PULSE to off until .base.ninst > 0 (see ks_pg_rf() on HOST) */
1136  rf->rfpulse.activity = PSD_PULSE_OFF;
1137 
1138  /* initialize number of occurrences of RF pulse to zero */
1139  rf->rfpulse.num = 0;
1140 
1141  /* setup rfpulse structure */
1142  status = ks_eval_rfstat(rf);
1143  if (status != SUCCESS) return status;
1144 
1145  rf->rfpulse.max_b1 = A0;
1146  rf->thetawave.res = res;
1147  rf->thetawave.duration = duration;
1148  rf->role = KS_RF_ROLE_INV;
1149  return status;
1150 }

void ks_print_waveform(const KS_WAVEFORM waveform, char *filename, int res)
Writes a KS_WAVEFORM to disk with the specified filename

◆ ks_eval_rf_hard()

STATUS ks_eval_rf_hard ( KS_RF *  rf,
const char *const  desc,
int  duration,
float  flip 
)

Sets up a KS_RF object with a rectangular (hard) pulse of a given duration.

This function creates a hard RF pulse of the desired duration. Hard pulses are typically used as non-slice selective RF pulses, as their slice profile would be very poor (Sinc-like). The resolution of the RF pulse created is equal to the duration/2

Parameters
[out]rfKS_RF object to be created
[in]descA description (text string) of the KS_RF object. This description is used for pulse sequence generation (seen in the file generated by TimeHist in MGD Sim/WTools)
[in]durationDesired duration in [us] of the waveform (must be even)
[in]flipNominal flip angle of the RF pulse
Return values
STATUSSUCCESS or FAILURE
1153  {
1154  KS_DESCRIPTION tmpdesc;
1155  int i;
1156 
1157  /* don't allow empty description or a description with leading space */
1158  if (desc == NULL || desc[0] == ' ') {
1159  return ks_error("ks_eval_rf_hard: RF name (2nd arg) cannot be NULL or leading space");
1160  }
1161  strncpy(tmpdesc, desc, KS_DESCRIPTION_LENGTH/2);
1162  tmpdesc[KS_DESCRIPTION_LENGTH/2] = 0;
1163 
1164  /* reset RF object */
1165  ks_init_rf(rf);
1166 
1167  /* fill in wave object */
1168  sprintf(rf->rfwave.description, "%s.wave", tmpdesc);
1169 
1170  if (duration > KS_MAXWAVELEN * RF_UPDATE_TIME || duration < 4) {
1171  return ks_error("ks_eval_rf_hard(%s): 'duration' (3rd arg) must be in range [4, %d]", rf->rfwave.description, KS_MAXWAVELEN * RF_UPDATE_TIME);
1172  }
1173  if (duration % 2) {
1174  return ks_error("ks_eval_rf_hard(%s): 'duration' (3rd arg) must be divisible by 2", rf->rfwave.description);
1175  }
1176 
1177  rf->rfwave.res = duration / RF_UPDATE_TIME;
1178  rf->rfwave.duration = duration;
1179  rf->iso2end = duration / 2;
1180  rf->start2iso = duration / 2;
1181  rf->bw = 0;
1182  rf->flip = flip;
1183 
1184  /* generate waveform with max 1.0 */
1185  for (i = 0 ; i < rf->rfwave.res ; i++) {
1186  rf->rfwave.waveform[i] = 1.0;
1187  }
1188 
1189  /* initialize amplitude to 1 */
1190  rf->amp = 1;
1191 
1192  /* set the usage of the RF PULSE to off until .base.ninst > 0 (see ks_pg_rf() on HOST) */
1193  rf->rfpulse.activity = PSD_PULSE_OFF;
1194 
1195  /* initialize number of occurrences of RF pulse to zero */
1196  rf->rfpulse.num = 0;
1197 
1198  /* setup rfpulse structure */
1199  STATUS status = ks_eval_rfstat(rf);
1200  if (status != SUCCESS) return status;
1201 
1202  return SUCCESS;
1203 }

int start2iso
